thread.title: Football: Defense keys Greenwood win over Bryant
thread.title_full: Football: Defense keys Greenwood win over Bryant

author: WALTER WOODIE Special to NWA Democrat-Gazette
title: Football: Defense keys Greenwood win over Bryant
text:
Football: Defense keys Greenwood win over Bryant By WALTER WOODIE Special to NWA Democrat-Gazette Posted: October 17, 2015 at 1 a.m.Updated: October 17, 2015 at 1 a.m. Daylon Hood of Geenwood runs for yards against the Bryant defense during Friday's game in Greenwood. 
GREENWOOD -- The Greenwood offense may have sputtered at times Friday night, but the defense was razor sharp. Enlarge Luke Hales of Greenwood runs into the Bryant secondary during the first half of Friday’s game at Smith-Robinson Stadium in Gr... (By: MARK STALLINGS) (Credit: Special to the NWA Democrat-Gazette) 
The Bulldogs shut down a potent Bryant offense, pulling away in the second half for a 38-7 victory at Smith-Robinson Stadium. 
Greenwood 38, Bryant 7 
Bryant^7^0^0^0^—^7 
Greenwood^3^14^14^7^—^38 
First Quarter 
Bryant — Kelly 23 from Burks (Ray kick), 9:01. 
Greenwood — Cooper 24 field goal, 5:42. 
Second Quarter 
Greenwood — Martin 3 run (Cooper kick), 7:10. 
Greenwood — Martin 4 run (Cooper kick), 1:05. 
Third Quarter 
Greenwood — Martin 8 run (Cooper kick), 10:44. 
Greenwood — Hood 4 run (Cooper kick), 1:24. 
Fourth Quarter 
Greenwood — Hood 4 run (Cooper kick), 9:03. 
Greenwood (7-0, 4-0 7A/6A-Central) are now 6-0 against Class 7A teams this season with at game at War Memorial Stadium against Little Rock Catholic in two weeks for a seventh. But a more important game looms next week when the Bulldogs host Siloam Springs, with a win clinching a berth into the Class 6A playoffs. 
"It was good win for us," Greenwood coach Rick Jones said. "I thought we played hard in all three phases. I challenge both the offense and defense lines to not take step back. I wanted them moving forward and never go backward." 
The Bulldog defense limited Bryant to just 249 total yards and 12 first downs. The Hornets had the conference's leading rushing attack coming into the night, but had just 128 yards in the game. 
"I cannot say enough about our defense because Bryant is so scary offensively," Jones said. "They do so many things well. They are down to their third tailback. Still, they are so fast and the quarterback can run and throw." 
After struggling through much of the first half, Greenwood did finish the game with 501 total yards, including 392 yards on the ground. Caden Martin and Daylon Hood, usually backup running backs, shone as each gained more than 100 yards rushing and combined for five touchdowns. 
"Our line blocked well up front, but our receivers were blocking downfield as well," Jones said. "I thought we executed very well. We got physical with them and tried to play very fast. 
"We like to think that if an opponent takes away the pass, then we will run it. The key is to be good enough to run or pass even when they know what is coming. We did that (running the ball) in the second half." 
Greenwood held Bryant to just three first downs and 102 total yards in the first half, 77 of which came on two passes on the Hornets' touchdown drive early in the first quarter. The Bulldogs limited the Hornets to just 25 rushing yards on 13 carries in the first half. 
"It takes a lot of preparation to get ready for (Bryant)," Jones said. "We stopped counting at 96 different formations and then they come out in something different in three separate plays early. We made a few adjustments after that." 
Quarterback Gunnar Burns hit Austin Kelly for a 54-yard pass, then again on the next play for a 23-yard touchdown to give Bryant a 7-0 lead with 9:01 in the first quarter. 
Greenwood took control of the game in the second quarter thanks to a pair of Caden Martin touchdown to open up a 17-3 halftime lead. 
The Bulldogs then completely dominated the second half, scoring on their first three possessions of the second half to blow the game open. 
Despite the loss, the Hornets can still clinch a 7A playoff berth when they return home next week to face Van Buren.
